sub_title: Functional Information Manager Digital Workplace Productivity at Nouryon
summary:
I started my career in a role to liaise between the business and the IT department given my mix of a Chemical Engineering (MSc) and IT background. After a few years my second passion came into play: people management and getting most out of my team through applying proper management styles and motivation (or as Strengthfinder calls it: Maximizer). Just over 10 years ago my team became a global team which needed to support a variety of teams in the Netherlands, Germany, Sweden, China, the UK and the USA. The cultural aspects of management have since fascinated me and I'm still learning.

In 2010 I was asked to setup a new department and create an Enterprise Content Management (ECM) vision and strategy to move this topic well into the 21st century (nicely links to my other Strengthfinder strength: Futuristic). Next came an opportunity to become the (Agile Scrum) Product Owner for our Corporate Social Intranet based on Office 365, an opportunity I embraced fully. The latest change/challenge is to build and shape the End User Services team of Solution Architects. We create roadmaps and design solutions around (mobile) workplace, productivity, ECM, communication and collaboration services. Our purpose is to increase productivity across the company ranging from office workers to first line workers in our factories.

Specialties: Process plant document and data management, process engineering to IT service providers liaison, change and people management, Agile Scrum Project Owner.

profile_positions.description:
Digital Workplace Productivity is the domain that encompasses the Digital Workplace (including the backend IT Infrastructure Services), Enterprise Content Management (ECM) and Digital Workplace Coaching (training of our end users). Most of the Infrastructure Services are related to the managed workplace, messaging, collaboration on files, voice and video services, Active Directory and Azure Active Directory, desktop and mobile hardware standards and more.

Enterprise Content Management primarily focuses on document management and archiving of documents governed by internal and external legislation. It's not just about the traditional archiving processes, it also includes integration of (for example: plant design and maintenance) data and documents to create a single view on important information. Lastly this topic also touches on Knowledge Management.

The Digital Workplace is the platform for our employees to connect, communicate, collaborate, find and share information and get access to business applications and employee services on approved devices, anytime, anywhere. Solutions included in its scope are: intranet, video, mobile, social and (3rd party) collaboration tools. This scope includes all of the Microsoft Office 365 solutions.

Digital Workplace Productivity is part of the IM Projects department and is about: managing the demands based on business requirements and being responsible for solution design. Supporting the development of the Digital Workplace strategy and drive its promotion and adoption. 

My role as Functional Information Manager includes managing the demands for the Digital Workplace scope, managing the internationally operating team (people management, career development, engagement, etc.), promoting/ensuring adoption of the services and platforms and manage the strategy and the various solution road-maps.
profile_positions.title: Functional Information Manager Digital Workplace Productivity at Nouryon
